page.title: 14Nazeing Glass Works
page.content:
We had a very interesting trip around Nazeing Glass Works. Mr. Madsen took us all around the factory and we saw stemmed glasses, ash trays and signal light covers being made.
Some of the men were moulding glass and others were blowing glass. Glass blowing is a technique that has stayed the same for hundreds of years. It is very skilful. We watched the men taking the lumps of molten glass and blowing into it. They blew and twirled until they got the shape they wanted.
About 130 people are employed at the works and most of them live in the surrounding area. About 75 people are employed making glass and the rest work in the offices.
